item.title: RMPocalypse: Single 8-Byte Write Shatters AMD’s SEV-SNP Confidential Computing
item.description:
Chipmaker AMD has released fixes to address a security flaw dubbed RMPocalypse that could be exploited to undermine confidential computing guarantees provided by Secure Encrypted Virtualization with Secure Nested Paging (SEV-SNP).
The attack, per ETH Zürich researchers Benedict Schlüter and Shweta Shinde, exploits AMD's incomplete protections that make it possible to perform a single memory

item.title: New Pixnapping Android Flaw Lets Rogue Apps Steal 2FA Codes Without Permissions
item.description:
Android devices from Google and Samsung have been found vulnerable to a side-channel attack that could be exploited to covertly steal two-factor authentication (2FA) codes, Google Maps timelines, and other sensitive data without the users' knowledge pixel-by-pixel.
The attack has been codenamed Pixnapping by a group of academics from the University of California (Berkeley), University of

item.description:
Bitcoin and Ethereum spot ETFs have recorded a combined $755M in outflows, reflecting renewed investor caution following sharp market losses and rising U.S.–China trade tensions.

The post Bitcoin and Ethereum Spot ETFs Bleed $755M as Post-Wipeout Fear Grips Traders appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Citibank to Launch Crypto Custody Services in 2026 After 3 Years of Preparation
item.description:
Citigroup plans to launch crypto custody services in 2026 after two to three years of development according to global head Biswarup Chatterjee, as the bank joins nine global banking giants developing a jointly-backed stablecoin with market projected to process over $50 trillion in annual payments by 2030.

The post Citibank to Launch Crypto Custody Services in 2026 After 3 Years of Preparation appeared first on Cryptonews.
